intro: Bourreria andrieuxii, commonly known as the Andrieux's bourreria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
